results.title: Making a Start in Oriental Brush Painting
results.brief_description: An introduction to this beautiful and absorbing art form. Kit Nicol, a talented watercolour artist shows the influence of her long interest in oriental art and culture and that the language of painting is universal. The various sections cover: starting to work, sitting position, brushstrokes, mastering of techniques, painting two subjects (roses and poppies) in full colour, and mounting and framing. Rated: G

results.title: Making a pack basket
results.creator_credit: Boy Scouts of America. Visual Education Service
results.brief_description: Pop Williams, an old-timer, demonstrates techniques for making a pack basket. He begins with the actual cutting down of an ash tree, stripping it out, and step by step, pounding out the weaving strips, weaving, attaching rims, handles and shoulder straps.

results.title: Making a decision is...
results.brief_description: Examines the decision-making skill in the making of decisions varying from trivial to life’s choices. Explores key considerations in helping to arrive at decisions. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Making a decision in the family
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Nicholas Balla and Julia Murphy
results.brief_description: Discussion film for adults on parental authority and teenagers. When a high-school girl declares her preference for going to a gathering of her own friends rather than to a family gathering, she runs headlong into her parent’s objections. It is their decision and not hers which is to abide. The result is a clash of wills. The question of what might have been a better approach is left with the film audience.

results.title: Making a car bumper
results.creator_credit: Brent Productions and Topical Film Company
results.brief_description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. A vocational guidance film showing the skilled work of the tool maker in large-scale production engineering.
results.description: The making of a steel bumper by a machine press is used to illustrate the skill of the makers of press tools, the punch and the die, by means of which quantities of bumpers can be produced with a minimum of skilled labour. results.title: Making a balanced aquarium
results.creator_credit: Plymouth Productions and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Two children make a balanced aquarium in a glass tank. They demonstrate the step-by-step procedures of collecting soil and river gravel, placing these and the water in the tank, gathering and planting pond weeds, and then obtaining fish and other water animals to complete their aquarium.
results.description: Two children make a balanced aquarium in a glass tank. results.title: Making 'The Girl from Tomorrow'
results.brief_description: The making of “The Girl from Tomorrow” provides teachers of media with an example of how this exciting series was made. Interviews with the director, Kathy Mueller and the producer, Noel Price are included along with technical information on just how the special effects were achieved.

results.title: Makin pitchas (A)
results.creator_credit: Golden Seahorse Productions and Richard Frankland
results.brief_description: Makin Pitchas is a compilation of four short films made by young Kooris who are a part of the Ballarat and District Aboriginal Cooperative (BADAC). The project was an initiative funded by VicHealth to encourage young Kooris to explore and articulate their experiences of mental health issues, most particularly family issues, grief, conflict, racism and bullying. The final product is intended to promote discussion of mental health issues among young people in Indigenous communities as well as acting as a tool for cross cultural education in mainstream organisations. “Believe in Yourself” (dir. Tim Stares) is the story of Dave, a koori youth who feels alienated and discouraged by his parents who would prefer he drop out of school and lay bricks for his father rather than follow his dream to be a filmmaker. “A World of Colour” (dir. Myles Walsh) focuses on a mediation session, after a basketball game turns into a racial slagging match. “Goodnight Irene” (dir. Tim Stares) tells the story of Ruth, a young girl who has to do a history project about family’s pastimes. Unfortunately she cannot report anything to her teacher because the memories her mother has of her past are too painful to discuss. In “Verandah Dreaming” (dir. Myles Walsh) Verna loses her husband in the war and her son to drugs. Hope seems further lost when her grandson is sent to prison for stealing a car. However, with the help of the Aboriginal Legal Service, Sammy joins an Aboriginal Dance group and finds direction to his life.
